title: YO
content:
YO, FreePgs looks awsome at 3GB/day and one time pay! Are you sure there's no catch? Cuz get this, one time I saw a site hoster advertise that they had unlimited bandwith.....and then when i finally found a terms of service or policy thing, they said something like "excessive bandwith usage will be terminated" GARG!

For FreePgs:
3. e) Making available copyrighted software which has been "cracked" (e.g., copyright protection for the software has been removed)
This is a little hard for a host not to use this policy. Um, does that apply to Keen files? (graphics, sounds, music)

4. We do not allow any type of applications, programs, software, or MP3 files on our server unless you are the full owner and/or have rights to redistribute the application/file.
But can I hotlink to other places or at least give a link to them? this brings up another important question.

If I hotlink files, I know the server that has the file will use its bandwith to send it, but what about the server with the actual hotlink? Does that server use bandwith too? I sure hope not.

As far as I am aware a hotlink will contact the server with the file relatively directly; the server with the hotlink only loads the link text and location.

Although I do believe there are certain sites that will store a file either from a home computer or a website for a short period of time for you.
